snippet: Preet Bharara, the top federal prosecutor in Manhattan, said Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo had disbanded a corruption panel prematurely and that his office would pursue unfinished investigations.
abstract: Preet Bharara, United States attorney for Southern District of New York, goes on the radio and takes aim at New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo over his decision to disband anticorruption panel; Bharara, not known for engaging in on-air rebukes of elected officeholders, says his office will pursue unfinished investigations of panel, known as the Moreland Commission.

byline.original: By THOMAS KAPLAN and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM
byline.contributor: Thomas Kaplan reported from Irondequoit, and William K. Rashbaum from New York. Russ Buettner, Susanne Craig and Marc Santora contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Preet Bharara, the top federal prosecutor in Manhattan, said Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo had disbanded a corruption panel prematurely and that his office would pursue unfinished investigations.

headline.main: Cuomo Caught Up in Rare Conflict With Prosecutor
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Caught Up in Rare Conflict With Prosecutor

keywords.value: Moreland Commission to Investigate Public Corruption (NYS)
keywords.name: organizations
